respStmt.resp: Transcribed from images of original letters
respStmt.name: Sarah Tew
Giuliano Sidro
Millie You
Maddie Qualls

publicationStmt.distributor: The Center for the Tebtunis Papyri, The University of California, Berkeley
publicationStmt.authority: The Board of Trinity College Dublin, The University of Dublin

availability.p: Available for academic research purposes only.

objectDesc.p: Handwritten letter of 4 pages on one sheet with writing on front and back. The paper is folded in half.

recordHist.p: Images taken from Trinity College, Dublin: Page 1Pages 2-3Page 4Page6

projectDesc.p: This document was created as part of the History of Papyrology project [https://histpap.info/] by Sarah Tew, Giuliano Sidro, Maddie Qualls, and Millie You. The project is in affiliation the Center for Tebtunis Papyri at the University of California, Berkeley.

editorialDecl.p: Text has been transcribed diplomatically without corrections, normalization, or standardization.

punctuation.p: All punction marks have been retained nd represented using the appropriate Unicode code character except for apostrophes and ampersands which have been escaped using ' and &, respectively.

segmentation.p: The text has been segmented into lines according to line breaks in the original text automatically by Transkribus and line groupings based on groups identified automatically or manually declared by Sarah Tew in Transkribus. Page breaks have been manually edited by Sarah Tew, Giuliano Sidro, Maddie Qualls, and Millie You after export from Transkribus.

handNotes.handNote: Written in black ink by B.P. Grenfell.

revisionDesc.change: Manually added TEI header to Transkribus tei.xml exported file.

body.ab:
My dear Smyly,
I ought to have written before
to thank you for your corrections on
the horoscopes, which were duly made.
Wilcken discusses the matter in his
Gr. Ostraca (which I suppose you
have seen) but he doesnt seem to me
to understand it quite.
Crusius paid me a visit here a
fortnight ago and showed me copies of

some Ptolemaic papyri from Gebelên which
they have at Heidelberg. One had
a double date (this between ourselves)
"the second year of Cleopatra (II) Soteira
(B.C. 129/8 according to Wilckens
Gr. Ost I. 785), ξ[ανδικος] πεμπτ̣η
= Φαωφι πεμπτη" ; later on in the
same papyrus Peritius is equated corresponds
to Mesore. I am sorry you have
given up your theory on the dates.
Perhaps this new one will be some
use. The change must have taken
place very shortly afterwards

We have practically finished O.P.
II and it will appear early in Nov.
It is unlucky for Wilcken that on
some points we shall put him out of
date. I suppose you have been
through his new readings on P.P.
If there is any thing you want me
to look at in the Oxford ones
let me know. We leave about
Nov. 5 to dig again in the Fayum
and have another shy at those d-d
mummies.
We are publishing some nice Ptolemaic

papyri at Gizeh in Wilcken's new
Archiv, which he says will be out
in November (??). I will send you
an "Auszug."
Remember me to Mahaffy & tell
him there have been many inquiries
for him here. I regret very much he
didnt turn up as usual this Sept.
I hope your book will be out soon. We
have been having a go at Revillout
on the ^ subject of marriage. He has completely misled
poor Mitteis.

Yours very sincerely
Bernard P. Grenfell
